alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:36PM EST until January 13 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting in excess of 45 mph. * WHERE...Midland, Bay and Saginaw Counties. * WHEN...From noon Friday to 1 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds may bring down snow covered tree branches resulting in scattered power outages. Blowing snow may reduce visibilities to below one mile at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Confidence has increased in accumulating snowfall with rain briefly mixing in Friday evening. Snowfall rates are expected to peak near one inch per hour Friday evening. Snowfall totals could approach 12 inches across the most northern portions of Midland and Bay Counties by Saturday afternoon. Strong winds are expected late Friday night into Saturday with gusts in excess of 45 mph as arctic air filters in behind the system sending wind chill values close to zero.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
